explains: adv. 非常地；可怕地；惊人地

sentences.en: I thought they played tremendously well, didn't you?
sentences.cn: 我认为他们表演得非常好，你不觉得吗？

sentences.en: University funding was tremendously biased toward scientists.
sentences.cn: 大学资助金是极度偏重于科学家的。

sentences.en: The proportion of the population who are over retirement age has grown tremendously in the past few years.
sentences.cn: 超过退休年龄的人口的比例在过去几年中已急剧增长。
